citations.narrative:
The licensee does not have medical records for adult dogs of annual vaccinations, monthly heartworm prevention
injections, 6-8 week routine husbandry evaluations, or the regular administration of medications for intestinal parasites, as
described in the Program of Veterinary Care. This information is essential for APHIS inspectors to evaluate the quality of
medical care provided by the facility and ensure the animals are protected from disease, injury, and illness.
Dealers must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These
records must include routine husbandry, such as vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, or treatments, performed
on all animals.
To be corrected by the close of business on 10/7/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee does not have medical records for adult dogs of annual vaccinations, monthly heartworm prevention 
injections, 6-8 week routine husbandry evaluations, or the regular administration of medications for intestinal parasites, as 
described in the Program of Veterinary Care. This information is essential for APHIS inspectors to evaluate the quality of 
medical care provided by the facility and ensure the animals are protected from disease, injury, and illness. 
 
Dealers must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These 
records must include routine husbandry, such as vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, or treatments, performed 
on all animals. 
 
To be corrected by the close of business on 10/7/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
